Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (only traces remaining), with some added red and added white preserved; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of a shield with star device of lozenges and buds with red fill and alternating black and red dots around edge; part of spiked rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group with the Filling Ornament. The features typical for this group of vessels are the milky white slip and the use of filling ornament, which is found only in this group of sherds. The presence of filling ornament also suggests that the vases were mostly likely the earliest in the Grand Style. The male figures portrayed on vases from this group are perhaps the most expertly depicted and may all have been done by the same hand. Finally, the attempt at creating some perspective is rather clumsy.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 110, p. 271, no. 698, pl. II, pl. 92)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (pl. 96, no. 795)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. V, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0757) (phase 2)
